values_cards.title: Adaptive Management Through Successive Crises
attention_policies: WAYS to maintain commitment to program goals despite external chaos (riots, pandemic, economic collapse)
ADJUSTMENTS needed when staff leave seeking better opportunities - filling gaps, recruiting
CREATIVE SOLUTIONS when banking system fails - getting grants to MSMEs despite capital controls
MOMENTS when agility matters more than perfect planning
SUPPORT TO GIVE when partners/MSMEs are struggling through same crises
RESILIENCE shown by continuing all activities despite 'successive crises'

quotes: The Bloom team made sure to commit to all the activities under the LGA despite the successive crises (2019 riots, the COVID-19 pandemic, the currency depreciation, electricity outage, Beirut Blast, the banking system default, and the political crisis)
This required an agile, perceptive and adaptive management
the banking restrictions and the unclear, inconsistent capital controls and measures lead to delays in distributing the grants
many staff members moved or travelled seeking better life opportunities, which created further challenges for the remaining Bloom staff
stories: Navigated 2019-2023 Lebanon collapse while running programs for MSMEs
Distributed grants despite banking crisis - creative workarounds
Maintained staff morale and program quality through Beirut blast, COVID, political crisis

values_cards.title: Non-Defensive Learning from Critique
attention_policies: OPPORTUNITIES in critical feedback to improve rather than defend
WAYS to respond that show openness to learn, not justification
PRACTICAL ACTIONS that resolve issues rather than explanations of why it happened
TONE that acknowledges validity of criticism without self-flagellation
GROWTH shown by implementing recommendations, not arguing with them

quotes: Can you make sure the comments don't sound defensive and help us sound open to learn and give a practical thing to do to resolve the issue?
stories: Receiving external audit with criticisms (mentoring structure, tailoring, matching)

values_cards.title: Human Rights as Operating Principles
attention_policies: PARTICIPATION - when team listens to MSMEs, partners, mentors and adjusts based on input
ACCOUNTABILITY - transparent, honest reporting upward (donor) and downward (beneficiaries)
NON-DISCRIMINATION - fair criteria applied consistently, no biases
EMPOWERMENT - capacity building that creates lasting skills not dependency
FLEXIBILITY that respects autonomy while providing structure

analysis_notes.context: March 22, 2023 - Same day as Nur Coop Etsy optimization (Conv 8). External evaluation by RPS of Bloom's work with RDPP (Danish development) for Lebanon Ghadan Accelerator (LGA) program. Program worked with MSMEs (micro, small, medium enterprises) providing training, mentoring, grants. Audit overall positive (68%+ satisfaction, surpassed KPIs) but identified areas for improvement.
analysis_notes.key_insight: This is EXTERNAL VALIDATION of Bloom's impact and approach. Not self-assessment like Conv 6 - independent evaluator (RPS) confirmed: (1) Innovative methodology, (2) Human rights-based approach, (3) Resilience through Lebanon crises, (4) 68%+ satisfaction. BUT also honest about gaps: mentoring structure needs work, programs need better tailoring, job creation limited. Bilal's response ('don't sound defensive, open to learn') shows growth mindset. The context of operating through Lebanon's 2019-2023 collapse (riots, COVID, Beirut blast, banking crisis) while maintaining program quality is extraordinary.
